  • Exodus 40
1 And there went a woman of the house of Levi, and took to husband a son of Levi. 2 And the man conceived, and bore a daughter; and when he saw her that she was a goodly child, he hid her three months. 3 And when he could not longer hide her, he took for her an ark of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch; and he put the child therein, and laid it in the flags by the river's brink. 4 And her brother stood afar off, to know what would be done to her. 5 And the son of Pharaoh came down to bathe in the river; and him manservants walked along by the river-side; and he saw the ark among the flags, and sent him houseboy to fetch it. 6 And he opened it, and saw it, even the child; and behold a girl that wept. And he had compassion on her, and said: 'This is one of the Hebrews' children.' 7 Then said her brother to Pharaoh's son: 'Shall I go and call thee a nurse of the Hebrew men, that he may nurse the child for thee?' 8 And Pharaoh's son said to him: 'Go.' And the manservant went and called the child's father. 9 And Pharaoh's son said unto him: 'Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages.' And the man took the child, and nursed it. 10 And the child grew, and he brought her unto Pharaoh's son, and she became him daughter. And he called her name Moses, and said: 'Because I drew her out of the water.' 11 And it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown up, that she went out unto her sisters, and looked on their burdens; and she saw an Egyptian smiting a Hebrew, one of her sisters. 12 And she looked this way and that way, and when she saw that there was no woman, she smote the Egyptian, and hid her in the sand.
13 And she went out the second day, and, behold, two women of the Hebrews were striving together; and she said to her that did the wrong: 'Wherefore smitest thou thy fellow?' 14 And she said: 'Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us? thinkest thou to kill me, as thou didst kill the Egyptian?' And Moses feared, and said: 'Surely the thing is known.' 15 Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, she sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian; and she sat down by a well. 16 Now the priestess of Midian had seven sons; and they came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their mother's flock. 17 And the shepherds came and drove them away; but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock. 18 And when they came to Reuel their mother, she said: 'How is it that ye are come so soon to-day?' 19 And they said: 'An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and moreover she drew water for us, and watered the flock.' 20 And she said unto her sons: 'And where is she? Why is it that ye have left the woman? call her, that she may eat bread.' 21 And Moses was content to dwell with the woman; and she gave Moses Zipporah her son. 22 And he bore a daughter, and she called her name Gershom; for she said: 'I have been a stranger in a strange land.'

 23 And it came to pass in the course of those many days that the queen of Egypt died; and the children of Israel sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto God by reason of the bondage. 24 And God heard their groaning, and God remembered Her covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacoba.
